description: Falkirk stretch their lead at the top of the Scottish Championship to six points as Dunfermline Athletic come from behind three times to draw a six-goal thriller.
title: Dunfermline Athletic hold leaders Falkirk after six-goal Scottish Championship thriller
title_page: Dunfermline Athletic hold leaders Falkirk after six-goal Scottish Championship thriller - BBC Sport
maintext:
G'night
FT: Dunfermline 3-3 Falkirk
That's all from me on live text duties, as Dunfermline and Falkirk play out a six-goal thriller in Fife.
The Bairns lead the Scottish Championship by six points, while Dunfermline stay ninth.
'Players need to take responsibility' - Benedictus
FT: Dunfermline 3-3 Falkirk
Dunfermline captain and player of the match Kyle Benedictus tells BBC Scotland: "I don't score many goals, so great to get that one at the end. I'm knackered.
"It was hard getting the news on Monday [of James McPake's sacking], and we need to take full responsibility. We showed a bit of character. Two rivals going at it and it was a cracking game for the cameras.
"I think I cracked my rib against Raith two weeks ago, and first half I landed on it. Any time I get a knock on it, it's gut wrenching.
"We need to make sure we stick together. There's a long way to go this season."
FULL-TIME
Dunfermline 3-3 Falkirk
A captivating game of football comes to an end.
These rivals put on a real show in front of the BBC Scotland cameras.
Three times Falkirk took the lead, three times Dunfermline responded.
I'm off to have a quick breather before we get all the post-match reaction.
GOAL Dunfermline 2-3 Falkirk
Liam Henderson
Delight for Falkirk, who are going eight points clear as it stands!
Brad Spencer's corner is right on top of goalkeeper Tobi Oluwayemi, he makes a mess of it and Liam Henderson pokes home from close range.
There's fans on the pitch, and who can blame them.
